isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - REMOVE - DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Drive Axles with Differential Lock.

important.para: When removing axle shafts, identify right and left shaft locations for reference during reassembly.

svcsubproc.para: Step numbers correspond to numbers in Figure 5.

note.para: For easier disassembly, the drive pinion nut can be loosened after driveline is disconnected.

step1.para: Remove stud nuts and axle shafts. (If used, remove lockwashers and taper dowels.) If necessary, loosen dowels by holding a brass drift in the center of the shaft head and striking it a sharp blow with a hammer.

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause injury.

step1.para: Remove bolts and lockwashers that fasten the carrier to the axle housing.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

svcsubproc.title: Drive Axle with Wheel Differential Lock
svcsubproc.para:
The Differential Lock should be removed first during disassembly of the differential carrier. Refer to REMOVAL AND DISASSEMBLY
.

step1.para: Remove the differential carrier assembly from the axle housing.
